overview.title: What this blend is
overview.text: The most established GH secretagogue pair. CJC-1295 is a GHRH analog that extends the GH pulse window; Ipamorelin is a clean GHRP that triggers the GH pulse without meaningful elevation of cortisol or prolactin. Used together, they produce GH release that more closely mirrors natural pulsatile GH than either compound achieves alone — which is why this pair is the standard entry point for GH-axis optimization.

safety.text: Pep-Talk curation pending: we’re reviewing the evidence and will expand this section soon.

use_cases.title: Use cases (real-world)
use_cases.text: Use cases are framed as intent + context, not as a recommendation.
People usually consider blends when they’re trying to simplify decision-making, stack fewer vials, or chase a combined effect profile. The downside is more moving parts and more uncertainty.
If one component would be a bad fit for you (meds, history, side effects), the blend is also a bad fit — even if the other component seems appealing.

interaction_summary.title: Interaction summary
interaction_summary.text: Interaction flags are category prompts — not dosing instructions.
Blends inherit interaction risk from every component. If one component has a meaningful interaction class, treat the blend as having that interaction class.
If you’re on prescription meds (especially cardio, anticoagulant/antiplatelet, serotonergic, immunomodulating), treat uncertainty as a reason to slow down and verify with a clinician.

evidence.title: CJC-1295 / Ipamorelin — reference index
evidence.notes: Index link for literature discovery. This file intentionally contains no protocol instructions.

disclaimer.text: This blend page is informational. It does not provide protocols or instructions. Claims must be supported by cited evidence.

practical.bottom_line: Pep-Talk curation pending: this practical summary will be expanded with real-world uses, common downsides, and red flags as evidence is reviewed.

blend.rationale: The most established GH secretagogue pair. CJC-1295 is a GHRH analog that extends the GH pulse window; Ipamorelin is a clean GHRP that triggers the GH pulse without meaningful elevation of cortisol or prolactin. Used together, they produce GH release that more closely mirrors natural pulsatile GH than either compound achieves alone — which is why this pair is the standard entry point for GH-axis optimization.
blend.synergy_note: CJC-1295 and Ipamorelin act on different receptors in the same GH release pathway — GHRH receptors and ghrelin receptors respectively. Activating both simultaneously produces a synergistic GH response larger than either alone. Think of it as a two-key ignition: one extends the release window, the other triggers the pulse.
blend.who_its_for: Body composition, recovery acceleration, sleep quality, anti-aging via natural GH elevation. The entry-level GH stack, typically dosed before sleep to amplify the natural overnight GH pulse.

component_roles.cjc-1295: GHRH analog — extends GH pulse duration and amplitude without cortisol or prolactin elevation
component_roles.ipamorelin: Selective GHRP — triggers a clean GH pulse through ghrelin receptors, minimal side-effect profile
